entry.title: Southern Oregon Regional Economic Development, Inc. (SOREDI) Names Blair Sundell as New Executive Director
entry.summary: Medford, Oregon – August 28, 2025 – The Board of Directors for Southern Oregon Regional Economic Development, Inc. (SOREDI) is pleased to announce the appointment of Blair Sundell as its new Executive Director. Sundell will assume the role on September 1, 2025, and brings with him a wealth of experience in economic development, strategic planning,… The post Southern Oregon Regional Economic Development, Inc. (SOREDI) Names Blair Sundell as New Executive Director appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Rogue Valley Travel Impacts 2024
entry.summary: Preliminary data for 2024 from a Dean Runyan Associates study for the Oregon Tourism Commission shows that total direct travel spending in Oregon rose 1.1% in 2024 compared with the 2023 total. Travel spending rose from $14.15 billion in 2023 to $14.3 billion in 2024, an inflation-adjusted increase of 1.0%. Adjusted for inflation, Oregon’s total… The post Rogue Valley Travel Impacts 2024 appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Douglas County Building Permits Drop in 2024
entry.summary: Building permit data from the U.S. Census Bureau shows that new housing construction in Douglas County as measured by permits for living units dropped to 190 units in 2024 from 246 in 2023. It was the lowest level since 2015 when there were 172 building permits for living units. Building permits in Douglas County peaked… The post Douglas County Building Permits Drop in 2024 appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: A Snapshot of Oregon Firms by Size Class, 2025
entry.summary: In the first quarter of 2025, Oregon had just over 155,000 private firms that were subject to paying unemployment insurance taxes. Over 108,000 of these firms had at least one payroll employee in March. More than 19 out of 20 firms (96%) with workers on their payrolls had less than 50 employees. While that left… The post A Snapshot of Oregon Firms by Size Class, 2025 appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Business Oregon and Oregon InC Award $3.7 Million to Support Oregon Innovators
entry.summary: Grant funding was awarded to eight Regional Innovation Hubs to support Oregon’s innovation-based entrepreneurs. AUGUST 12, 2025 Business Oregon and the Oregon Innovation Council (Oregon InC) are pleased to announce the intent to award 2025-2027 Regional Innovation Hub grants. Regional Innovation Hubs provide technical assistance, access to capital, networking, mentorship and talent development to innovation-based… The post Business Oregon and Oregon InC Award $3.7 Million to Support Oregon Innovators appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Business Oregon Funds Unique Solution to Oregon’s Wine Bottle Shortage
entry.summary: AUGUST 29, 2025 Revino Inc.’s new bottle-washing facility in the Portland metro area will bring washable, reusable, American-made glass wine bottles to the market. Oregon’s wine industry generates $8 billion worth of economic activity in the state, employing more than 40,000 people, and it is increasingly constrained by an unreliable supply chain for glass bottles.… The post Business Oregon Funds Unique Solution to Oregon’s Wine Bottle Shortage appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Creative Industries project gains legislative funding
entry.summary: Southern Oregon University is celebrating a piece of its future by acknowledging the Oregon Legislature’s recent approval of $40 million in capital construction bonds to update and consolidate SOU’s facilities for creative industries – music, media and film. The cross-disciplinary project will transform the university’s programs and help secure Oregon’s future as a national leader… The post Creative Industries project gains legislative funding appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: A Concise Communication
entry.summary: One very important area of business success to highlight is communication. Great communication is avalue-driver and a success measure. It follows that having an efficient and concise communication abilityis fundamental to the success of any business. We are bombarded with messaging from multiple sources on a constant basis, so our filters aredeveloped to screen out… The post A Concise Communication appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: SOU Digital Cinema named to national Top 30
entry.summary: (Ashland, Ore.) — Southern Oregon University’s Digital Cinema program has been ranked among the nation’s Top 30 film schools by MovieMaker Magazine for the second consecutive year – a recognition of SOU’s role in preparing Oregon’s next generation of creative professionals. MovieMaker cited SOU Digital Cinema’s distinctive blend of hands-on training, industry partnerships and cross-disciplinary collaboration. entry.title: Umpqua Public Transportation District announces temporary service reductions
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY — According to a press release from Umpqua Public Transportation District (UPTD), transportation service reductions will start Sept. 15 across five bus lines. The UPTD Board of Directors voted to implement the changes on Aug. 27.
